abstract.text: An object that contains information about Rakuten Reward SDK basic functions, such as SDK initialization, log action, open portal and etc.
Post action code to achieve mission (Objective-C).
If there’s network problem or token is expired, action will be saved offline. Maximum 3 action codes.
You can subscribe to didUpdateUnclaimedAchievement(:) callback to get updates if mission is achieved.
Token type to differentiate application’s login system. By default, value is RakutenAuth.
Reward SDK’s version.
Reward SDK logout function. Clear cache data and set SDK status to offline. This logout function is for all login/token types.
Callback for Reward SDK portal is show/hidden updated. This can be called before startSession.
Open third party login page (for RakutenAuth token type / external user).
Open webview for Reward SDK advertisement portal page.
Application’s custom url session.
This function is to refresh user’s point and rank. (Objective-C)
For iOS 14 and above, please set the IDFA or ad tracking ID to this property.
Start session for 3rd party user
An object that contains information about Rakuten Reward SDK basic functions, such as SDK initialization, log action, open portal and etc.
Reward SDK’s mission list.
Reward SDK’s user object. Subscribe to RakutenReward.userUpdatedNotification or didUpdateUsernotification for changes.
Callback for user updated. This can be called before startSession.
Callback for new achievement after
. This can be called before startSession.
Access token.
Post action code to achieve mission
If there’s network problem or token is expired, action will be saved offline. Maximum 3 action codes.
You can subscribe to didUpdateUnclaimedAchievement(:) callback to get updates if mission is achieved.
Reward SDK’s status. This status is offline by default.
Set isDebug to true to print more logs. isDebug is false by default.

Reward SDK’s environment. For application developers, only production is available. Please create a different application (appcode) to use for testing. The current staging environment is for internal (Reward SDK team) only.
Claim unclaimed item you get from getUnclaimedList(completion:).
An object that contains information about user’s member points and member rank. (Objective-C)
Open Reward SDK’s portal. (Objective-C)
Application code.
Get mission list for current app. (Objective-C)
Get user’s point history.
Callback for Reward SDK advertisement portal is show/hidden updated. This can be called before startSession.
Present webview for Reward’s support page such as help page, terms and condition page, and privacy policy page. (Objective-C)
Initialize Reward SDK with appcode and access token. This is for both RAE and RID token type.
Callback for user updated. This can be called before startSession. (Objective-C)
Claim unclaimed item you get from getUnclaimedList(completion:).

. Use this API to get callback for Ichiba deeplink

or
notification for changes.
This function only indicates Login with Internal Login type
Get mission list for current app.
Initialize Reward SDK with appcode and access token. This is for RakutenAuth token type.

Reward SDK’s environment. For application developers, only production is available. Please create a different application (appcode) to use for testing. The current staging environment is for internal (Reward SDK team) only.
Error object for log action and claim mission.
Callback for Reward SDK status updated. This can be called before startSession.
A list containing blocked URLs. This is to block access to specific URLs.
This is used for Apple’s AppStore rejection. Use this API if the advertisement URLs have problem.
Reward’s support page type.
Shared object for RakutenReward.
An object that contains information about mission, such as getting the mission’s name, action code, instruction, icon url, notification type etc. (Objective-C)
Get user’s unclaimed missions/items.
SDK user updated notification.
This function is to refresh user’s point and rank.
Reward SDK’s supported region. By default, value is Japan.
Get user’s unclaimed missions/items. (Objective-C)
Open Reward SDK’s portal.

Reward SDK’s environment. For application developers, only production is available. Please create a different application (appcode) to use for testing. The current staging environment is for internal (Reward SDK team) only.
